work_definition.name: Work Definition
work_definition.correct: Work is energy transferred by a force acting over a displacement. Work equals force times displacement in the direction of the force, and equals the change in energy of the object.

work is force.error: Work requires both force AND displacement.
work is force.fix: W = Fs. Force alone doesn't do work; the object must move.
work is force.action: Holding a heavy box stationary = zero work (no displacement).

work is energy.error: Work is the CHANGE in energy, not total energy.
work is energy.fix: W = Î”E = E_final âˆ’ E_initial. Work transfers energy.
work is energy.action: Work done ON object increases its energy. Work done BY object decreases its energy.

work is power.error: Power is rate of work. Work is energy transferred.
work is power.fix: P = W/Î”t. Power is work per unit time.
work is power.action: Work = total energy transferred. Power = how fast it's transferred.

work requires motion.error: Partially correct, but displacement must be in direction of force component.
work requires motion.fix: Need displacement AND force component in that direction.
work requires motion.action: Carrying a box horizontally: gravity does zero work (perpendicular).

persistent.gap: You don't understand what work means in physics.
persistent.action: Work = energy transferred by force over displacement. W = Fs = Î”E. Scalar quantity, unit = joule (J).

work_units.name: Work Units
work_units.formula: W in joules (J) = N Ã— m = kg mÂ²/sÂ²
work_units.correct: Work is measured in joules (J). One joule equals one newton-metre: the work done when a 1 N force causes 1 m displacement.

units are N.error: N is force. Work = force Ã— distance = N Ã— m = J.
units are N.fix: W = Fs, so units are N Ã— m = J (joules).

units are W.action: Don't confuse W (symbol for work) with W (unit of power).

units are N/m.error: N/m is spring constant. Work is N Ã— m.
units are N/m.fix: W = Fs â†’ units are N Ã— m = J, not N/m.
units are N/m.action: Multiplication, not division: force TIMES distance.

J and N m are different.fix: 1 J = 1 N m = 1 kg mÂ²/sÂ². All equivalent.
J and N m are different.action: Joule is just a name for newton-metre in energy context.

persistent.action: Work unit = joule (J) = N m. 1 J = work done by 1 N force over 1 m displacement.

work_scalar.name: Work as a Scalar
work_scalar.formula: W = Fs (scalar, can be + or âˆ’)
work_scalar.correct: Work is a scalar quantity. It has magnitude but no direction. However, it can be positive (energy gained) or negative (energy lost).

work is a vector.error: Work is scalar. The sign indicates energy gain/loss, not direction.
work is a vector.fix: Force and displacement are vectors, but their product (work) is scalar.
work is a vector.action: Positive/negative work = energy gained/lost, not a direction.

work cannot be negative.error: Work can be negative when force opposes motion.
work cannot be negative.fix: Negative work means energy is removed from the object.
work cannot be negative.action: Friction does negative work: removes KE from moving object.

negative work means no work.error: Negative work is real work; it removes energy.
negative work means no work.fix: âˆ’50 J means 50 J of energy removed from object.
negative work means no work.action: Braking: negative work done on car, KE decreases.

sign depends on direction.error: Sign depends on whether force aids or opposes motion.
sign depends on direction.fix: Force in direction of motion: +W. Force opposing motion: âˆ’W.
sign depends on direction.action: It's about force relative to displacement, not absolute direction.

persistent.gap: You don't understand work as a scalar with sign.
persistent.action: Work is scalar. Positive = energy added to object. Negative = energy removed from object.

work_formula_basic.name: Work Formula W = Fs
work_formula_basic.correct: When force is parallel to displacement, work equals force times displacement: W = Fs. This is the simplest case.

W = F/s.error: Multiply force by displacement, don't divide.
W = F/s.fix: W = F Ã— s, not F/s.
W = F/s.action: More force OR more distance = more work. Multiplication.

W = F + s.error: Can't add force and distance; different units.
W = F + s.fix: W = F Ã— s. Multiply, don't add.
W = F + s.action: N + m is meaningless. N Ã— m = J (work).

s is distance travelled.error: s is displacement in direction of force, not total distance.
s is distance travelled.action: If you walk in a circle back to start, displacement = 0, work by you = 0.

any force counts.error: Only force component parallel to displacement does work.
any force counts.action: Carrying box horizontally: gravity (vertical) does no work.

persistent.gap: You're making errors with the basic work formula.
persistent.action: W = Fs where F is force parallel to displacement s. Unit: J = N m.

work_angle.name: Work at an Angle
work_angle.correct: When force is at angle Î¸ to displacement, only the parallel component does work: W = Fs cos Î¸.

W = Fs sin Î¸.error: Use cosine for parallel component, not sine.
W = Fs sin Î¸.fix: cos Î¸ gives component parallel to displacement.
W = Fs sin Î¸.action: At Î¸ = 0Â° (parallel): cos 0Â° = 1, so W = Fs. Correct.

always use W = Fs.error: Only when force is parallel. Otherwise need cos Î¸.
always use W = Fs.fix: W = Fs only when Î¸ = 0Â°. General formula: W = Fs cos Î¸.
always use W = Fs.action: Pulling wagon at angle: only horizontal component does work.

Î¸ is angle from vertical.action: If pulling at 30Â° above horizontal, and moving horizontal, Î¸ = 30Â°.

cos Î¸ can be greater than 1.action: Maximum work when force is parallel to motion.

persistent.action: W = Fs cos Î¸. Î¸ = angle between F and s. cos 0Â° = 1 (parallel), cos 90Â° = 0 (perpendicular).

perpendicular_force.name: Perpendicular Force Does No Work
perpendicular_force.correct: A force perpendicular to displacement does zero work because cos 90Â° = 0. The force changes direction but not speed.

perpendicular force does work.error: Perpendicular force changes direction, not energy.
perpendicular force does work.action: Centripetal force: perpendicular to velocity, does no work.

gravity always does work.error: Gravity only does work when there's vertical displacement.
gravity always does work.fix: Horizontal motion: gravity perpendicular, does no work.
gravity always does work.action: Carrying box horizontally at constant height: gravity does 0 J.

circular motion gains energy.error: Uniform circular motion has constant speed, no energy change.
circular motion gains energy.fix: Centripetal force âŠ¥ velocity â†’ no work â†’ constant KE.
circular motion gains energy.action: Satellites: gravity does no net work over complete orbit.

persistent.gap: You don't understand when forces do zero work.
persistent.action: Force âŠ¥ displacement â†’ zero work. Example: centripetal force, carrying horizontally.

area_under_graph.name: Area Under Force-Distance Graph
area_under_graph.correct: The area under a force-distance graph equals the work done. This works for any graph shape and is especially useful when force varies.

gradient gives work.error: Gradient gives rate of force change. AREA gives work.
gradient gives work.fix: Area under graph = work. Gradient = dF/ds.
gradient gives work.action: For work: calculate AREA, not gradient.

only for constant force.error: Area method works for ANY force variation.
only for constant force.fix: Constant force: rectangle. Varying force: use appropriate shapes.
only for constant force.action: This is WHY we use graphs: handles varying force easily.

height gives work.error: Height is force. Work = force Ã— distance = area.
height gives work.fix: Area = height Ã— width = F Ã— s = work.
height gives work.action: Read force from y-axis, distance from x-axis, calculate area.

units don't matter.error: Must check axis units before calculating.
units don't matter.fix: Convert kN to N, cm to m, etc., before calculating area.
units don't matter.action: Area in N Ã— m = J. If axes have other units, convert first.

persistent.gap: You don't know how to get work from F-s graphs.
persistent.action: Work = area under F-s graph. Check units. Use geometric formulas for shapes.

graph_shapes.name: Calculating Areas of Different Shapes
graph_shapes.formula: Rectangle: bh, Triangle: Â½bh, Trapezium: Â½(a+b)h
graph_shapes.correct: Different graph shapes require different area formulas: rectangle (constant force), triangle (force from zero), trapezium (force changes between two values).

always multiply axes.error: Only for rectangles. Other shapes need specific formulas.
always multiply axes.fix: Triangle: Â½ Ã— base Ã— height. Trapezium: Â½(a+b) Ã— h.
always multiply axes.action: Identify shape first, then apply correct formula.

triangle area = base Ã— height.error: Triangle area is HALF base times height.
triangle area = base Ã— height.fix: A = Â½bh for triangle. Don't forget the Â½.
triangle area = base Ã— height.action: Triangle = half of rectangle with same base and height.

can't handle curves.error: Curves can be approximated or use counting squares.
can't handle curves.fix: Count squares method: count full squares + estimate partials.
can't handle curves.action: Each square = (force unit) Ã— (distance unit) = energy.

add forces not areas.error: Break into shapes, find each area, then add areas.
add forces not areas.fix: Total work = sum of areas of all shapes.
add forces not areas.action: Complex graph: rectangle + triangle = total area = total work.

persistent.gap: You're making errors calculating areas from graphs.
persistent.action: Rectangle: A = bh. Triangle: A = Â½bh. Trapezium: A = Â½(a+b)h. Sum all areas.

positive_work.name: Positive Work
positive_work.formula: W > 0 when F and s in same direction
positive_work.correct: Work is positive when force has a component in the direction of motion. Positive work increases the object's energy.

positive means rightward.error: Positive means force aids motion, regardless of direction.
positive means rightward.fix: Push right, move right: +W. Push left, move left: also +W.
positive means rightward.action: It's about force relative to motion, not absolute direction.

all work is positive.error: Work can be negative when force opposes motion.
all work is positive.fix: Force opposing motion does negative work.
all work is positive.action: Friction always does negative work (opposes motion).

positive work only from engines.error: Any force in direction of motion does positive work.
positive work only from engines.fix: Gravity does positive work on falling objects.
positive work only from engines.action: Pushing, pulling, gravityâ€”all can do positive work.

persistent.action: Positive work: force component in direction of motion. Object gains energy.

negative_work.name: Negative Work

negative work means object slows.action: Lifting object: gravity does âˆ’W, object gains PE not KE.

persistent.action: Negative work: force opposes motion. Energy removed from object. Common: friction, braking, lifting against gravity.

work_energy_theorem.name: Work-Energy Theorem
work_energy_theorem.correct: The net work done on an object equals its change in kinetic energy. If only KE changes, W_net = Î”KE.

W = KE.error: Work equals CHANGE in KE, not total KE.
W = KE.action: If object already moving, include initial KE in calculation.

applies to single force.action: Multiple forces: add their work (with signs) to get net work.

only for horizontal motion.action: Free fall: W_gravity = Î”KE (PE converts to KE).

u and v are speeds.error: u and v are speeds, but careful with Â½mvÂ² formula.
u and v are speeds.fix: KE = Â½mvÂ². Use speed (magnitude of velocity).
u and v are speeds.action: KE is always positive (scalar). Direction doesn't matter for KE.

persistent.action: W_net = Î”KE = Â½mvÂ² âˆ’ Â½muÂ². Net work on object = change in kinetic energy.

work_by_multiple_forces.name: Work by Multiple Forces
work_by_multiple_forces.correct: When multiple forces act, calculate work by each force separately (considering direction), then add to get net work.

perpendicular forces add.action: Normal force (perpendicular): W = 0, doesn't affect sum.

persistent.action: Calculate each force's work (with sign), then sum. Or use F_net Ã— s.

zero_work_cases.correct: Work is zero when: (1) no force, (2) no displacement, or (3) force perpendicular to displacement.
